review_body: I've been using this app since the day it launched and it is my favorite way to quickly scan photos and documents. It works better than the built in scanner in Google Docs even with its updates. The app hasn't been updated since 19 Apul 2019 so PLEASE Google don't let another really great but little...Full ReviewI've been using this app since the day it launched and it is my favorite way to quickly scan photos and documents. It works better than the built in scanner in Google Docs even with its updates. The app hasn't been updated since 19 Apul 2019 so PLEASE Google don't let another really great but little known app fall disappear into the Google abyss.

Great quality picture scanning, but unfortunately very poor in record the information about the picture. When you scan an old picture, it doesn't allow you to specify when was taken to our even add any other note to it. Everything gets saved with the date and time you scan the picture. I still like ...Full ReviewGreat quality picture scanning, but unfortunately very poor in record the information about the picture. When you scan an old picture, it doesn't allow you to specify when was taken to our even add any other note to it. Everything gets saved with the date and time you scan the picture. I still like and recommend the app, but wish this issue gets addresses.

The app got spoilt after latest update. It hangs suddenly after the update. And please add an option to share scanned images in the app after selecting multiple images. And please turn off the auto rotate feature or atleast an option to toggle it. I'm happy that it doesn't say "Scanned by PhotoScan"...Full ReviewThe app got spoilt after latest update. It hangs suddenly after the update. And please add an option to share scanned images in the app after selecting multiple images. And please turn off the auto rotate feature or atleast an option to toggle it. I'm happy that it doesn't say "Scanned by PhotoScan" at the bottom of the image.

App works wonderful. I had several photo albums that I wanted digital. They would have been impossible to take them apart without ruining them and the album pages were too big to use a flat bed scanner. With good lighting I was able to scan and crop the pages and they turned out as good as original.

I want a great and fast photo copying app but this is worse than just taking a photo. It takes 4 clicks and 4 alignments for 1 photo. It doesn't always get the whole photo. It uses your flash draining the battery. It usually saves you cropping. Yes it does a job but is hard work.

I love this app Works as told Best scanning feature What not.. It's from the company of Google.. Which makes it even more innovative and attractive It works for us and makes us feel free by rotating, cropping,and doing all the necessary things on its own. Which makes it even more innovative and attractive It works for us and makes us feel free by rotating, cropping,and doing all the necessary things on its own. It reduces our work load What else to expect.. Everything is amazing here

The resolution of the resulting scan is quite a bit lower than a regular image taken with the phone camera, resulting in sometimes unreadable text, making the app basically useless. I like the concept of merging 4 pics to remove glare (works partially) and getting a straighter image, but with the lo...Full ReviewThe resolution of the resulting scan is quite a bit lower than a regular image taken with the phone camera, resulting in sometimes unreadable text, making the app basically useless. I like the concept of merging 4 pics to remove glare (works partially) and getting a straighter image, but with the low resolution it's not useful.

This app does not remove glare from photos, no matter how many times I've tried. Flash on or off, multiple lighting settings. Every time a photo finishes processing, all I'm left with is the initial photo taken in the app. And before it's suggested, I definitely have glare removal switched on.

I have scanned over 600 family photos mostly from the early 1900's and before. It works well once I figured out the optimum placement of the photo and light settings. I am still getting some with glare but I can usually scan a second time and avoid it.
I don't own a scanner and have always had trouble taking pictures of tangible photos in order to share them with others. This app is easy to use and divers amazing quality. Great job!!!!

Horrible app! More often than not the image quality is far worse and blurrier than just using the regular old camera. Also, it automatically crops out important parts of what I'm trying to scan. The app is a waste of time.

App is fine, just came all the way here to say, screw you guys for putting an unskippable intro on the app, I'm an old user, had a fresh install, just need to get in the app, and every time I try to skip demo or back out of it, it starts from scratch.... Frustrating to no end
This is just not functional as a photo scanner. Just produced a very low quality digital photo of the print I wanted to scan on the surface it was placed on. Really of no use unfortunately.
Wonderful. No shine, no glare, no reflection at all. No cropping is needed. This is very useful to convert hard copies of photos to digital copies.

This app is amazing! Amazing amazing amazing. Instead of costing me $3 per photo to get a copy made I scanned them with this app and got them printed for about $0.12 each. The quality is awesome and it's super easy to use.

Not very intuitive and cohesive. I would prefer the documents I scan to save in a separate folder apart from my main pictures, for organization purposes and so I can control it uploading to the cloud. Also when selecting multiple images, only option is to delete. Would like a share option too.

Good app used a lot work well deserve 5 star but there is a lack.... How to save easy photo scanned with program? When developers will add that option I will edit review and give 5 🌟. But good work anyway. Thanks

I thought it did a great job for most all of my photos. Some (very few) contained a slight glare but comparing it to other apps, it was totally fixable. I love the corner catchers, makes it easy and very resourceful. Thanks y'all!
Love it, just wish I could save the photos to my sd card instead of the internal memory. I'm digitizing my Grandmother's photo album and this app has made it so easy!
Brilliant app. Was looking for something like this to convert my old photos to digital and this does the job perfectly.

I didn't even know I had this app on my phone and was excited to see it as I needed a photo scanner, however, in my experience it doesn't work as well as the paid ones I have used before. The scans come out so blurry even though it makes you take 5 pictures. I have had apps that take one picture com...Full ReviewI didn't even know I had this app on my phone and was excited to see it as I needed a photo scanner, however, in my experience it doesn't work as well as the paid ones I have used before. The scans come out so blurry even though it makes you take 5 pictures. I have had apps that take one picture come out better. Also I couldnt figure out how to connect scans that are related into the same file. I'm surprised Google would develop an app this junky

All is well except colors sometimes. Sometimes it over processes but sometimes it under processes. So colors are a hit and miss (mostly less saturation) if you compare it to actual photos. Overall, app is very useful. glare removal and edge detection is excellent.

I used this app about a year ago and nothing has changed. I've always been a big fan of Google & their products, but this one needs some work. Make every picture better than before: Clean, smooth, no grainy outcome!
A really good scanner for my android phone (I don't have a computer scanner these days), but for shaky old guys like me it's a bit frustrating to actually get the scan right away
Not that accurate. It also scans part of the background. You also have to contrast the document to make the scanned photo clearer.

Didn't found it that useful as What's the difference between clicking the pic of any object using Device camera and using this app to capture the same object ? Can anyone explaine me so that I can edit my review and can give more stars to this app ? If it really deserve ..
I scanned 4 pictures from the early 70's and the they turned out great. The pictures themselves were definitely aged but when scanned, they cleaned up nicely.
This is really not a good app. 90% of the time photos come out with glare anyway and it takes several tries to get them glare free / correctly colored. You're much better off using a scanner.
Great way to scan photos. Just wish there was a soft light. There having a light, and no light. I would like to have an in between
Basically like taking a pic. Which i prefer the pic. Not as time consuming and you still get to edit your pic your way.

PhotoScan absolutely delivers as promised. Picture perfect and glare free enhanced digital scans of all your printed photos via your phones camera. Excellent approach/method to securely back up all printed photos (hard copy). The automatic cropping based on edge detection is executed with precision ...Full ReviewPhotoScan absolutely delivers as promised. Picture perfect and glare free enhanced digital scans of all your printed photos via your phones camera. Excellent approach/method to securely back up all printed photos (hard copy). The automatic cropping based on edge detection is executed with precision and care. However, smart rotation keeps your photos right-side-up, no matter which way you scan them. Overall, all printed photos captured via PhotoScan are safely backed up via Google Photos.

Very good attempt but the scans of old photos don't come out as good as say scanning them using a scanner. Certain areas, especially the corners, are often grainy. Black and white photo scans are much better than old colour photo scans
This app works great, took a few scans to figure it out but then I was off and scanning. Works great on just about anything, removes glare, shadows, etc... Simple and impressive.

I scan and send old family photos to relatives near and far. It gives us a way to have conversations about family history and also to fill in some blanks.

I was honestly just expecting an app that just uses my camera to make it seem like it did something when it just took a regular picture. I retract that. This blew me away. Good and quick, the quality is moderate, but enough if you want to scan loads in only a couple hours.
The cropping is nice, but the end result is just not the best quality. If I simply take a photo of my photo it looks significantly sharper than the final processed image using this app.

Removes the glare that happens when you use your phone to take a picture of a real photo!!! Then it even auto-crops(adjustable corners if needed) and enhances the picture. For most of the time it does not work properly. I find that the 'scan document' feature on Google Photos is much more useful for saving photos to your phone.

For documents and situations where resolution is not important, this app works great. However, resolution is bad. The app removes glare sometimes, but not others. (I think it may have something to do with how distant the source of the glare is.) The big problem with the app is that it often cuts off the edges of an object... it tries to crop automatically, but often cuts off too much.
Excellent app for scanning your old pictures and keeping their digital copies. Really impressed with the results. Wasn't expecting glare removal to be this good for a phone app.
Great app. There's no problem with the intro...showed once then never again. Took a photo in the dark and made it look normal. Nice. Thanks
Great app to be used as an alternative to photo-scanning. It works great for detailed photographs and text documents. This program handles light glare and dimensional image distortion problems.
Works well, fast and easy to use. I wish it would let you edit the Exif data to set the date taken per the original picture.
Just doesn't work. Cannot move the outlined circle over the filled in circles. Uninstalling.

Easier and faster to scan photos and documents than a scanner!
I'm having a really hard time with my senior photos. Thought i'd give this app a try. Does NOT take out glare like it says it does and the photos look horrible

It's really amazing! It scanned better than any other app I've used and the quality is absolutely wonderful. I love this app and it scans perfect well in absolute dark conditions as well(that's how I first tried it and it produced a quality image). Loved it 5 stars!

Terrible.it is suitable for scanning small size documents..you can't get clear scan of A4 size documents,in order to keep documents within the frame u have to keep camera to far so it give blur photo.
Best to scan photos on mobile!!! Only thing, i wish they would make it scan faster without cutting down on the quality of the scan.
Works great for getting Polaroid pictures on your phone, quality isn't not the best but it still passes.

Each photo scanned upside-down. The auto-crop cut off the edges of each photo and I had to manually adjust the edges of each scan. The images weren't blurry, but that's the ONLY positive thing that can be said about this app.
Why is there not picture enhancement and colour correction features? It would be the best photo scanning app in the world if it did!
It would be nice to have the option of switching the storage location of the photos from the internal storage to an SD card.
Resolution of the finished scan is poor. A normal photo of the picture is clear, but not when using this app. Not worth it if you want a reasonable copy of the picture.
This app is so perfect because I have photos when I was a baby and my family and my dad kept them so I wanted a copy of them just in case they get damaged

Great app! Amazing scans! I use it every once in a while. Unfortunately I'm punished for having uninstalled the app by an unskipable tutorial. EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. I. INSTALL. THIS. APP. Please add a skip tutorial button for those of us that have seen it a dozen times already
Scanned photos are good, feels like it was almost done via printer. You can edit the borders as well so you cab remove frames or background.
Perfect! I scanned a magazine cover with lots of glare and now the photo looks PERFECT!! Well done!
Picture quality it much poorer than the default camera of my phone. But the crop and glare removal works great. Got much to improve in terms of resolution and clarity.
best app for scanning old photos, made by Google and fool proof for getting the best quality

Easy. Quick. Better quality then using my printer scanner which took forever. Very happy with the results and was able to share some old photos with family very fast. In some cases I think the scanned photo looked better then the printed original.

Output result is blurrier and lower resolution than just using native google camera app. Photo is taken before view is centered on one of the 4 dots, so the photo is taken when you are still moving. The result cannot be expected to be anything but poor from this behaviour.
Really good app, it can scan docs producing quality images.
The one time I needed it this year, it got stuck in the slow, unskippable intro/tutorial. Better to just tilt your phone a little.
Requires almost perfect conditions to work properly, it focuses too much on cropping to the point it will skew the photo. Needs work.
Doesn't work at all keeps saying to move the circle over the dots and every time I get the message couldn't complete the scan

I LOVE THIS APP! I recently came across my deceased mother's many, many photo albums, and this app has made it possible to scan quality digital reproductions without paying oodles of dollars to have a professional service do it.

Great app. Its actually better than camscanner which is a chinese malware according to me..

This was hard for me to rate it offs btwn a 3-4 for me sometimes it helps take a better photo especially in situations that you don't have the luxury of finding a well lit area... when you can I would take pics without the app because it takes forever comparably

Nice idea but the resolution is much too low to be useful. MS Office Lens does a much better job.
This is a GREAT app! It does what it says, removes the gloss or the reflection. I highly recommend it!!
Excellent for saving old photos!!! Just love this program!!!

I need this app for class and it will not work. I take a photo with it and when I hover over one of the dots it starts to load but then freezes and says cannot complete scan. It's very frustrating and I cannot find anything about how to fix it....
Some of old familly photos revived again. This app is perfect for this type of work.

Its a great app does a magical work of scanning pictures and documents to the very minute details...... never seen such a good technique of scanning..... hope to see the Water mark go(that is why a star is less) orelse it is the best.
Works really well. I wish it would scan to PDF without the watermark.
I can't do scan, whenever do a photo scan I couldn't find the circle at the four corners. Developers kindly find the solution as soon as possible
Very good app for old photo scanning, it is very useful for making your manual memory into digital format.

Works pretty well. Not a replacement for a printer/scanner, but if you can place a photo in bright light (don't use flash!), without too large an area of glare, you can make a pretty nice, quick scan of a photo anywhere you happen to be. Nice for dropping in on relatives and looking through the fami...Full ReviewWorks pretty well. Not a replacement for a printer/scanner, but if you can place a photo in bright light (don't use flash!), without too large an area of glare, you can make a pretty nice, quick scan of a photo anywhere you happen to be. Nice for dropping in on relatives and looking through the family album. Might take one or two tries to eliminate glare and haze.

I really love the idea, and the execution is quite solid. There is one big flaw, though, which is that color reproduction is quite bad if your lighting is not very well engineered. Also I wish it could be used to get bit higher resolution (Which should be possible since it is basically image composi...Full ReviewI really love the idea, and the execution is quite solid. There is one big flaw, though, which is that color reproduction is quite bad if your lighting is not very well engineered. Also I wish it could be used to get bit higher resolution (Which should be possible since it is basically image composition)   My key concern, though, is color. For that what I wish they'd add is option to use color patches for calibration (So have black and white squares next to the photo and use those for black/white point)   Also option to export raw format and can be edited later on desktop would be nice. At the moment I think this app is cool, but it isn't good enough that I'd dare to destroy the physical copies of the pictures.

Direct Share is not available So, what is the use of the app if I have to upload, then, download again, every scanned photo. There it lost one star. Then, every photo is branded with the app name. There goes another star.
This app work great.Some stupids say that this app doesn't work correctly because they need to upgrade their phones.Trust me and download this app.it is a best photo scan app

App is incredibly basic and incomplete. First, realize that the quality of the scans are barely acceptable by today's standards! I get lots of blur and double-vision effects. I get better output from a regular camera photo. I'm using a Google Pixel 3, so go figure.  As for the basics: After scanning...Full ReviewApp is incredibly basic and incomplete. First, realize that the quality of the scans are barely acceptable by today's standards! I get lots of blur and double-vision effects. I get better output from a regular camera photo. I'm using a Google Pixel 3, so go figure.  As for the basics: After scanning, there is no photo adjustment. No brightness, no color, no rotation. There's no way to LABEL THE PHOTOS!? No way to organize them in folders!? No way to choose storage location/card. This seems half-baked at best.

author_name: Andrés Juan Carlos Ramos Brabant Mateo
review_body: I have been using PhotoScan for pictures that my grandmother had. Even with photos from the 1920's that were faded have been scanned in perfectly. I'm very satisfied.

This app is great! The problem is that it completely stopped my Samsung s8 plus camera from working. I tried everything and until I uninstalled this app nothing would work. Once uninstalled my camera magically started to work again.
Scanner is good. But mandatory tutorial without 'skip' button in plain stupid.
Exceptional app, particularly with how it corrects for glare and detects boundaries. This app is an absolute pleasure to use.
Simply useless..... Although taking more time extra.... My mobile default camera is far far better than this..... I dpnt know why Google create this type of useless appp.

The original version worked beautifully, position the camera above the photo, tap each corner to give the app reference points, perfect every time. The current version is nearly unusable, you have to move the camera around to align the circle in four dots to give reference points. Sounds simple but ...Full ReviewThe original version worked beautifully, position the camera above the photo, tap each corner to give the app reference points, perfect every time. The current version is nearly unusable, you have to move the camera around to align the circle in four dots to give reference points. Sounds simple but the execution is horrible, every pic is now skewed and requires correction after taking the shot. Learn to leave 'good' products alone, fix your apps that aren't good.

In case you're thinking of using this for scanning documents, my experience was that the resulting image had the text so blurry as to be useless. An ordinary phone snap produces very nice sharp text so I'll stick to that

usability-wise this app is 5 stars. incredibly easy to get started and scan the photos. only giving 3 stars because the quality of the scans is really not that great. I'm using a Google pixel 3, so i don't think my phone camera is the bottleneck in achieving that...

I wanted to like this app but it's just not good. The issues are that the automatic edge detection doesn't work ever. You have to manually correct each photo. They don't tell you that lighting matters a lot as this app doesn't do white balance correction and a low light photo will ghost. Finally, ev...Full ReviewI wanted to like this app but it's just not good. The issues are that the automatic edge detection doesn't work ever. You have to manually correct each photo. They don't tell you that lighting matters a lot as this app doesn't do white balance correction and a low light photo will ghost. Finally, even in good light and following all directions and manually correcting the corners, the resolution is still extremely low. The scanned photos lack detail and the image file is tiny. Your almost better off doing a panorama photo and cropping it out in Snapseed.

The app is really great, way better and faster than manually scanning them or taking picture of the picture. I will give 4 stars due to a missing feature that I would really love to have, the option to set the timestamp of the picture before (or after). For old photo albums, where you can have sever...Full ReviewThe app is really great, way better and faster than manually scanning them or taking picture of the picture. I will give 4 stars due to a missing feature that I would really love to have, the option to set the timestamp of the picture before (or after). For old photo albums, where you can have several photos at the same day, it would be easy to do and also it would show correctly on Google Photos timeline.

While the scanning of photo is exceptional, the options post scanning are limited. It would be great if option to change the date of the scanned photo is provided (currently it shows up on Google Photos as an on date photo, which is weird for a photo from 50 years ago). Another feature that i would ...Full ReviewWhile the scanning of photo is exceptional, the options post scanning are limited. It would be great if option to change the date of the scanned photo is provided (currently it shows up on Google Photos as an on date photo, which is weird for a photo from 50 years ago). Another feature that i would like to see in this app is the ability to make albums, so that date of the entire album can be set manually, instead of doing it individually for the photos. Please consider making these changes.

I have scanned photos of various aged from 5 years to 60 years old and they all scam brilliantly. I have S9 phone. I gave 4 stars and not 5 because it can drain your battery. Keep phone on charge as you scan and all is good.
I deleted this app a couple of years ago because it was worse than just taking a pic. It hasn't changed. I don't think a single feature was added.

This is a very good app for scanning a picture for a picture. It helps get rid of glare that a single picture would not get rid of. Picture should be flat, and well lit for best results. It does not do perspective control, and it is not an image editor - it didn't claim to be. What would make it bet...Full ReviewThis is a very good app for scanning a picture for a picture. It helps get rid of glare that a single picture would not get rid of. Picture should be flat, and well lit for best results. It does not do perspective control, and it is not an image editor - it didn't claim to be. What would make it better (for me) is that since it is sort of taking five pictures to make one, the option to save the picture at a higher resolution. A very good program for its intended job, and it's free.
Seems to work good, no problem transferring old photos to my phone, it's free so there is no risk in trying it. Might not be for professionals.

Tried several pictures and the glare it creates is more than anything caused by light in the room. A simple pic in bright indirect light worked way better than the app. Would love to upload the pics it took and show you the comparison

Great app to digitalise you old photos, just one problem though, image quality is NOT VERY GOOD, as compared to your mobile camera. You literally can't understand anything if you zoom in even a little.
Tried using this and kept getting poor quality photos which always had the shadow of my phone on them. i have gone back to using a flatbed scanner which is just as quick and far better quality.
Fabulous.. Helpful.. Very nice. Absolutely good for them who don't want to go out 🏡 or cyber cafe to scan files... THANKS Google PhotoScan for this initiative

great app, but it would be better if you can provide an option to enter date n time of the photo by ourselves because it's an app for childhood pics mainly, right?

The most impressive photo scanner I've used. Not that I've used many but this is really something else.

After last update when i scan photo in indoor or in low light conditions , during scanning the flash automatically turned off and the photo comes with dark blue tint and i couldn't read anything in it. Btw i am using Mi A1 on 9.0. but it is problem with android 8 also

dropped to just 3 stars because every few days the app thinks I've never scanned photos before and resets the excruciatingly long, unskippable opening animation and it's at the point where I'm going to just dump it all together. The main area where i use this is to take photos of a monitor or glass-...Full Reviewdropped to just 3 stars because every few days the app thinks I've never scanned photos before and resets the excruciatingly long, unskippable opening animation and it's at the point where I'm going to just dump it all together. The main area where i use this is to take photos of a monitor or glass-covered image and i need the app to just OPEN AND WORK, not play a 30 second animation on how to use it every time. There have been several instances where I've opened the app and missed an image.

Stupid "PhotoScan by Google Photos" on each scan! Scanner is much worse than the camera app quality... So what is the point? At least one should be able to save a text document as an OCR'ed PDF and at better quality!

I'm not sure if it's because I was doing it at night. When I scanned photos with flashlight on, the glare wasn't removed at all (it was actually "strengthened" a little bit...). And when I did it with flashlight off, the scan results were blurry and unclear. :(

hands down this is the best scanning app I have ever used for pictures scans and that is saying a lot! keep up the good work Devs 👍🏻 (I'm sure it's not easy working in such an immoral company such as Google LLC)
Doesn't work tried different settings still get glare on photos, does not remove it. 16/12/19 update vastly improved scans very fast once you get the knack and glare free mostly.
The app is a 50/50 gamble. Sometimes the four dots are at a weird angle, sometimes the end result is blurry. I have a Samsung galaxy s8. UPDATE: it's better now. Using it on the S10 2/8/20
I tried it again after long long time hoping that they update app and may scan in good quality but still same,my phones camera capture way clearer image then this.
App is glitching, circles on four corners aren't functioning properly. Not also good for scanning documents as letters on papers aren't that discernible and readable.
Most of the times the scanned photo looks bad with weird colours and not precisely cropped. Not as good as I expected
after the update ISO is very low due to which photo comes out more darker then normal picture we take from camera. please fix this issue.

Thanks again to Google for another useful application to suit most people. Personally, I haven't used it yet but am looking forward to editing my review at that time.  For those people who felt compelled to leave a negative review, there are a few points that that you should consider.  (#1) The app ...Full ReviewThanks again to Google for another useful application to suit most people. Personally, I haven't used it yet but am looking forward to editing my review at that time.  For those people who felt compelled to leave a negative review, there are a few points that that you should consider.  (#1) The app is FREE, (#2) The condition of the original source photo and focus should have everything to do with what you are expecting (i.e. - 110 photo or Polaroid, overexposed with heads cut off and mildew damage probably won't resemble an Olan Mills portrait), (#3) A picture of a picture is a fine alternative.  If none of these points satisfy you and you can build a time machine and recreate the moment, up to and including the resurrection of long dead relatives to hold fake smiles and not close their eyes, then please do and let me know in the comments, until then I will patiently hold my breath until I turn blue.   To Google, thanks again and keep up the good work!

Quite primitive. For better capture the app shall include a level or gauge to ensure the pic is not out of the plane. (Updated: the new version to save the scanned photo in one go is **not** good. It greatly increase the time to save the scanned photo. Better to have an option to switch this new fea...Full ReviewQuite primitive. For better capture the app shall include a level or gauge to ensure the pic is not out of the plane. (Updated: the new version to save the scanned photo in one go is **not** good. It greatly increase the time to save the scanned photo. Better to have an option to switch this new feature on and off.)

Used to be better.  The annoying caption when I share photos and the un-skippable intro video after I updated the app are mildly annoying but the way the dots keep moving and the unimpressive results are more so.

It does scanning of photos pretty well. However syncing of scanned pages to Google photos cannot be disabled. As a result, your friends and families photo albums would get cluttered with boarding passes, pages from books, etc.

The first picture I scanned was perfect. The next one I scanned SEVEN times and there was a terrible glare on it every time!!! The original picture doesn't have a glare at all. It was when it scanned the picture that it would get the glare. I moved the phone to different areas of the picture when sc...Full ReviewThe first picture I scanned was perfect. The next one I scanned SEVEN times and there was a terrible glare on it every time!!! The original picture doesn't have a glare at all. It was when it scanned the picture that it would get the glare. I moved the phone to different areas of the picture when scanning it to see if that would help. I also  did it at different heights, or distances from the original. Nothing helped.

This app has come a long way in the short time that it has been out. When stitching pictures of text together sometimes double vision / blurring occurs, however, this does not appear to happen when capturing pictures of paintings / art work.  I love the cropping and automatic perspective correcting ...Full ReviewThis app has come a long way in the short time that it has been out. When stitching pictures of text together sometimes double vision / blurring occurs, however, this does not appear to happen when capturing pictures of paintings / art work.  I love the cropping and automatic perspective correcting features; pictures nearly always come out with no glare.  It would be good to have an option for capturing art works at high Res and text files / documents at a more optimal file size. At this stage the app seems to do a good job of this automatically, however, it would be a nice option to have 'manual' or 'auto' file size management.

Wasted hours scanning photos to my phone only to realize you cant export the photos from the app itself, other than one by one. Also when you share a photo there is a tacky watermark from Google. Save your time and scan the photos or find another app.

Before the update I liked this app. But the update removed the controls for saving and backing up scans. As a result the initial scan is automatically saved to Google photos and there is no capacity to save adjusted ( rotated, cropped etc) photos to the cloud. Now u have to delete the original photo...Full ReviewBefore the update I liked this app. But the update removed the controls for saving and backing up scans. As a result the initial scan is automatically saved to Google photos and there is no capacity to save adjusted ( rotated, cropped etc) photos to the cloud. Now u have to delete the original photos from the cloud, transfer the adjusted photos from my phone to PC, and then save them to the cloud. What a pain.

The quality of this app used to be great, but it has gone down significantly over time.  It has significant problems now with most basic things like identifying the corners of photos (even dark photos scanned against a white background get half cut off).  It introduces colored artifacts on photos, a...Full ReviewThe quality of this app used to be great, but it has gone down significantly over time.  It has significant problems now with most basic things like identifying the corners of photos (even dark photos scanned against a white background get half cut off).  It introduces colored artifacts on photos, and the ability to remove flash glare works only sometimes.  Other times, the scan is left with a bright spot somewhere.  And because it now automatically saves to google photos, both the well-scanned photos as well as the bad ones get backed up to google photos.  You don't have the ability to delete the bad ones or rotate/corner adjust the photos before uploading to google photos.  You have to go to google photos and remove the bad photos from there.  Scanning old photos went from tedious to double-tedious and error-prone.  Google just couldn't leave well enough alone.

When it correctly identifies the edge of the photo, it does a good job of receiving the glare that one would typically have when taking a picture of a picture.  I've scanned about 5 pictures and on 2/5 I didn't have to retake the picture.  The rest took more than two times for the app to correctly f...Full ReviewWhen it correctly identifies the edge of the photo, it does a good job of receiving the glare that one would typically have when taking a picture of a picture.  I've scanned about 5 pictures and on 2/5 I didn't have to retake the picture.  The rest took more than two times for the app to correctly find or at least have the edge in the picture.

So much easier than putting our old family photos on a scanner.  Don't even need to take them out of the album. It even sharpens some of the pics that are faded. Only wish I could add information about each picture as I take them. Unless I'm missing something, I have to go into my Google Photos app ...Full ReviewSo much easier than putting our old family photos on a scanner.  Don't even need to take them out of the album. It even sharpens some of the pics that are faded. Only wish I could add information about each picture as I take them. Unless I'm missing something, I have to go into my Google Photos app after my pictures are scanned to add things like dates and people in the pictures.
Ive seen it work ok on other phones, but not on mine. Messed with settings but never solved it. Photos were scanning black half the time. Grey and blurry the rest.
Pretty useless. I was hoping I could get a big document scanned (you know, like something that can't fit on a scanner) but the size limit is way too small.

I found this app unusable.  It requests that photo overlay for all programs be turned off before you can set the permissions for the app. However, even after you go through the trouble of figuring out how to do so, your still stuck with the same pop-up requesting that you turn off photo overlay.  At...Full ReviewI found this app unusable.  It requests that photo overlay for all programs be turned off before you can set the permissions for the app. However, even after you go through the trouble of figuring out how to do so, your still stuck with the same pop-up requesting that you turn off photo overlay.  Attempts at using the email address to the developer led me to another rabbit hole, equally useless.

I really loved this app upon release, but I'm now having a few struggles with it, photo results seem to be nowhere near as good as before. Hope this can be fixed, if so it's a 5 star from me! Great app.

Cool concept and well-implemented from a user experience point of view. Very good at capturing a photo without glare. But it can't be 5 stars for me until it can capture high-quality photos. This definitely doesn't replace a scanner, and I would not spend time backing up my photo albums, considering...Full ReviewCool concept and well-implemented from a user experience point of view. Very good at capturing a photo without glare. But it can't be 5 stars for me until it can capture high-quality photos. This definitely doesn't replace a scanner, and I would not spend time backing up my photo albums, considering the poor resolution of the photos.

A week ago I would have given in 5 stars...  Why on earth has the 'Save' button been removed??!  The process before worked absolutely perfectly:  1. Scan a pile of pictures  2. Proof check all the rotation/ corners making adjustments as you went  3. Save all to device once you were absolutely certai...Full ReviewA week ago I would have given in 5 stars...  Why on earth has the 'Save' button been removed??!  The process before worked absolutely perfectly:  1. Scan a pile of pictures  2. Proof check all the rotation/ corners making adjustments as you went  3. Save all to device once you were absolutely certain that all the photos had been checked and approved by you   Now, the app is just doing the saving bit all by itself - so you don't know if it saved before or after proofing :(

I've suggestions here is, scanned photo should be saved on Google drive in scanned Photo folder instead of camera folder, so that It would be easy to find out required document...Full ReviewGood app to scan documents, but I've a question here, how to rename the file while saving or uploading to google photos.?   I've suggestions here is, scanned photo should be saved on Google drive in scanned Photo folder instead of camera folder, so that It would be easy to find out required document.

I hardly ever write reviews so take that for what it is worth .....I was in a hurry to scan pictures for a slideshow at a funeral.  Thought it might be faster to try an app rather than use my scanner at home.  There were still plenty of glares in several of the photos even though it came up and said...Full ReviewI hardly ever write reviews so take that for what it is worth .....I was in a hurry to scan pictures for a slideshow at a funeral.  Thought it might be faster to try an app rather than use my scanner at home.  There were still plenty of glares in several of the photos even though it came up and said not to worry about the glares.  Many came in blurry and had to rescan.  Some were clear on the bottom and blurry on top.  Some had very distorted sections in the photos - likes faces.  I scanned about 150 photos in just a couple of hours.  It was simple to use.  The lighting in the room where you scan makes a difference.  I wanted to check what a good distance from the pict was as I am sure that makes a difference.  And it is good to make sure the phone is level.  My phone was almost full on storage, so I was surprised that I didn't fill it with as many photos as I scanned.  I picked this program first to try and didn't try any others as I thought I would be --  spending some of my time just trying out different apps.
Why blurry pictures?  Why such poor quality?  It's better to just take a photo of the image.

Very mixed feelings about this app. Scanned pictures look amazing, but sharing them automatically adds a "PhotoScan by Google Photos" stamp to the bottom of each image. Anyhow, picture quality is very good, and the stamp only appears when you share images directly from the app, so it isn't exactly a deal breaker. I would appreciate the choice whether to promote the app using my pictures, though, since I'd be glad to do it in other ways. A bad move in an otherwise great app.

Really great idea, but I get better and faster results from my regular camera app. Have been using it for months hoping for better updates. This app simply works poorly and rarely gets the framing right. Super blurry most of the time. I really hope they make this app better.

The image proces...Full ReviewRidiculously bad quality makes this useless and defeats the purpose. Photo cameras are already bad scanners for 2-dimensional objects, but you can get much better results by just taking a normal, high-resolution photo with your phone camera in good lighting, playing with the angles. The image processing of this app doesn't effectively remove glare, but it does result in more blurry and lower res images, compared to taking a normal photo.  Seems more like Google developers playing with a new and interesting technology rather than a useful and finished product.

Great easy to use scanner. You must take your time and not shake during the scan for quality pictures. Not sure why so many users are complaining about quality?   I scanned a picture from 1972 and it looks 100% better than the original. The Orignal was all cracked & faded but the scanned image looks...Full ReviewGreat easy to use scanner. You must take your time and not shake during the scan for quality pictures. Not sure why so many users are complaining about quality?   I scanned a picture from 1972 and it looks 100% better than the original. The Orignal was all cracked & faded but the scanned image looks great no signs of the cracks. I think of you just take your time the pictures scan better than the original.

I'm having a problem where my flash turns off when it should stay on while going over the white dots which is causing the glair to stay and not go away,  anyone can help, the app is useless without gd lighting in this case...  I tested it out on other phones and they don't have the problem so...

Very easy to use. Just line up the dots and you are set. The ability to remove glare is very impressive. Not impressed with the resolution, however. Images can out rarely blurry. I still recommend using a good lighting setup and a standard camera app.

Microsoft's Office Lens app works way better than this. Does not do what you advertised. Maybe this has been tested on a Pixel phone, but I have the Google Nexus 5X and the photos look terrible. With taking 4 pictures, I should get an even higher resolution than by just taking one. Nope. Turns out w...Full ReviewMicrosoft's Office Lens app works way better than this. Does not do what you advertised. Maybe this has been tested on a Pixel phone, but I have the Google Nexus 5X and the photos look terrible. With taking 4 pictures, I should get an even higher resolution than by just taking one. Nope. Turns out worse than if I just took a regular picture.

Works pretty well. Depending on the lighting conditions the quality of your phone camera turning the flash on or off helps the picture quality. Also, if the photo curls up on the side(s) at all this app may show show an edge or two but you can't really blame it for that.

The idea is good but the image quality both in terms of color reproduction and sharpness is borderline terrible. Image size of the scanned image is also way too small. I would not use this as a replacement for a proper photo scanning solution.  I notice that "high end" devices get better resolution....Full ReviewThe idea is good but the image quality both in terms of color reproduction and sharpness is borderline terrible. Image size of the scanned image is also way too small. I would not use this as a replacement for a proper photo scanning solution.  I notice that "high end" devices get better resolution. Why not let the end user select if high resolution is wanted?  The app is still basically useless for scanning photos for most devices as long as not more phones are supported.

Microsoft office lens is way better. It allows us to capture and save full resolution photos. But office lens can't eliminate flash light glare. This app lets pixel phone to capture full resolution. Sadly I had Redmi 3s prime only.

I've had pretty good experiences with this app. It's fast and in most cases the results are acceptable. I've backed up a huge amount of family photos from my grandmother and I believe I would not have been able to do that we'll without this app.

The app tries it to hard optimizing the photo. Results look very unnatural. Finding the right picture borders and its orientation is excellent. It's a pity that the resulting bad image resolution/quality makes it unusable.

The idea is a good one but the performance is sub-par. If u take a pic with your normal camera it'd come out with much better resolution but maybe more glare. If you take it with this app the corners are perfect, no glare, but the quality is meh.

This app is a cool concept, but the execution is abysmal. Suffice to say, don't bother downloading this app because it is utterly and entirely useless. The images you scan fail to remove glare and they are only 2 – 3 megapixels. My phone normally takes photos at over 12 megapixels. You can distinctl...Full ReviewThis app is a cool concept, but the execution is abysmal. Suffice to say, don't bother downloading this app because it is utterly and entirely useless. The images you scan fail to remove glare and they are only 2 – 3 megapixels. My phone normally takes photos at over 12 megapixels. You can distinctly see the pixelation on your phone screen without even zooming in. The photos are so low res that you're better off not even bothering to scan them at all.
"Don't worry about the glare." It's a big blurry mess covered in glare and my reflection holding my phone. Not quite ripe yet, Google. I'm better off with my regular camera.
It used to be good for scanning photos and documents. Not as good any more and they added their logo to my documents so hard pass now. Sad I'll have to look for other apps.

I've had much better results just snapping a picture of a picture. It took 5 crystal clear images and made them so blurry I couldn't really make anything out. It's a good idea that needs another year of rnd or something.
Great idea, terrible implementation! The quality of the photos is terrible. I'd rather use office lens or even my stock camera which is far better than this

The quality of the photos was worse than when I just took a picture of the picture. (I have an HTC One M9.) Sometimes the app did reduce glare, but sometimes it didn't. Overall it was too much work for low quality pictures, and I will just go back to photographing photos.

Photos were of low quality. Had better luck taking a photo and cropping.  Sections of photo did not align properly. App needs to allow input of photos as my native camera app on my Nexus 5 takes much nicer photos than this app does. It had trouble focusing.
Great way to digitize old photos. Also, I love that I can use it to save my kiss's artwork. Things that I might have once thrown away to keep the house clean can be digitized and saved.

Really awesome..  It's the merging of edges is soo perfect 👌.. and performs exactly like a scanner  Best of all the photo scanners I've used  Just try once and I'm sure you will fall in love with it..  Thanks for the application ☺️

DOES make glares, with or without flash. Camscan is a better app for scanning then this awkward attempt. Takes too long, you can't get into the dots easily like it demonstrated, etc. Skip this Google app, there's others out there.

I really want to love this app. It's a really great start, but needs some refinement that I'm sure it will get as Google polishes it up. My phone (Galaxy S7 Edge) goes out of focus (after initial clear focus) while I'm in the "moving from dot-to-dot" stage and the dots will "lock on" to an out of fo...Full ReviewI really want to love this app. It's a really great start, but needs some refinement that I'm sure it will get as Google polishes it up. My phone (Galaxy S7 Edge) goes out of focus (after initial clear focus) while I'm in the "moving from dot-to-dot" stage and the dots will "lock on" to an out of focus image before prompting me to move on to the next dot. A focus lock feature after the initial focusing would be great and would alleviate pretty much all of my frustration with the app.

Performance needs improving, even on the Pixel Great idea interfacing with the pre-digital era, and it would be better if the picture performance could be improved. Right now it works well in natural light but poorly under artificial. One major issue is poor focusing, even when using the flagship Pixel phone. On the plus side, the stitching and ...Full ReviewGreat idea interfacing with the pre-digital era, and it would be better if the picture performance could be improved. Right now it works well in natural light but poorly under artificial. One major issue is poor focusing, even when using the flagship Pixel phone. On the plus side, the stitching and perspective matching has worked wonderfully!

Fast and Easy but Not Sharp Super easy to scan photos, but even with a 20MP camera, plenty of light, no glare, the photos scan at about 2.5MP and each of the scanned photos saved with an artsy-like watercolor-ish effect to them. Whether a photo was sharp and clear itself, whether scanned from a scrapbook with vinyl over it, wh...Full ReviewSuper easy to scan photos, but even with a 20MP camera, plenty of light, no glare, the photos scan at about 2.5MP and each of the scanned photos saved with an artsy-like watercolor-ish effect to them. Whether a photo was sharp and clear itself, whether scanned from a scrapbook with vinyl over it, whether scanned just by itself - all of them saved with that effect. Haven't tried black and whites yet. The takeaway: if you want something that is simple and easy, use it. If you want super sharp scans, don't.

Low resolution Unfortunately,  I'm able to get better scans with my stock camera app because of the low resolution on PhotoScan.  Can't see the detail in a scan that I'm  able to get with a photo through  my stock camera. I really hope there'll  be an update to fix this issue. Tested on a Nexus 5X. I compared a scan done with my ancient Epson scanner with the one from Photoscan.  The one from the scanner is clearer. The photoscan photo is slightly blurry in comparison. The file from photoscan is 2000x1333 96dpi file size 467KB. Given that google advertises "hi-resolution"...Full ReviewTested on a Nexus 5X. I compared a scan done with my ancient Epson scanner with the one from Photoscan.  The one from the scanner is clearer. The photoscan photo is slightly blurry in comparison. The file from photoscan is 2000x1333 96dpi file size 467KB. Given that google advertises "hi-resolution" photos from photoscan I wonder what they define as hi-res?  I tested the app with 2 photos. One was a typical glossy photo. it did a great job of eliminating glare. The other was a professional photo with a textured matte finish. Photoscan could not eliminate the glare. I tried it several times.  So, if you do not have a scanner and don't mind waiting the 5-10 seconds or so to scan with your phone and you don't care that the pics are slightly blurry, this app may be for you. Please note that you must click "Save" on the photos after doing the scan or they won't show up in your google photos app.

Amazing for an initial release! Keep up the amazing work, Google! I'm sure this is in the making, but thought I'd mention it: the "scanned" resolution needs to be higher. This is a 8MP camera, taking 5 photos. So should at least stay around 8MP, no? (Minus the crop, I know) Pro tip: enable us to add/edit the timestamp of the scann...Full ReviewKeep up the amazing work, Google! I'm sure this is in the making, but thought I'd mention it: the "scanned" resolution needs to be higher. This is a 8MP camera, taking 5 photos. So should at least stay around 8MP, no? (Minus the crop, I know) Pro tip: enable us to add/edit the timestamp of the scanned photos. Now it seems they were shot "today" but we actually want them to be dated e.g. 30 years ago. Just a thought.

Great idea, but currently unusable This could really have been a great product. The interface is easy and fast. Unfortunately, the quality of the resulting images is terrible. I would expect image quality better than a regular photo using the device, but it's actually way worse. Someone else wrote about this app, and put it very well...Full ReviewThis could really have been a great product. The interface is easy and fast. Unfortunately, the quality of the resulting images is terrible. I would expect image quality better than a regular photo using the device, but it's actually way worse. Someone else wrote about this app, and put it very well: this app makes great looking thumbnails, but it can't be relied on to make even remotely valuable scans of your photos.

Great if not super picky I had no trouble lining up the circles, corners, focusing, distortion, or anything else technical. Don't know why others had problems. Works great if u need to archive a box of old photos or aren't super picky about the colors. I'm an artist, tho, and find the pics too washed out & high contrast for...Full ReviewI had no trouble lining up the circles, corners, focusing, distortion, or anything else technical. Don't know why others had problems. Works great if u need to archive a box of old photos or aren't super picky about the colors. I'm an artist, tho, and find the pics too washed out & high contrast for my needs. I'll count on it getting better with updates. I will def use it to scan my boxes of family pics to preserve memories,  tho. LG G3.

Nice idea but the result is worse than just a regular (one shot) cropped photo . I tried many times the same picture with and without this app. The photoscan photo is  always blurrier with higher contrast than the real. Also the resolution is lower than the regular cropped photo. So whats is the ben...Full ReviewNice idea but the result is worse than just a regular (one shot) cropped photo . I tried many times the same picture with and without this app. The photoscan photo is  always blurrier with higher contrast than the real. Also the resolution is lower than the regular cropped photo. So whats is the benefit? A single photo with just cropped-perspective  selection  would be simpler and better, but that would be too simple to justify a separate app. Why don't you just integrate the perspective-crop in "Google Photos" edit tools? On the plus side i guess is the flare removal of the flash. But using the flash is a bad choice to begin with either way for scanning a printed photo-document.

The app is great but please fix Google Photos! Every since Google stopped supporting Picasa there has been no way to manually geotag and tag faces. So please oh great developers at Googl...Full ReviewEvery since Google stopped supporting Picasa there has been no way to manually geotag and tag faces. Also adjusting the dates is a huge pain since you have to edit them one by one in Google Photos. This is an app where those features would REALLY come in handy. So please oh great developers at Google. Face tagging, geotagging and date/time editing should be built into this app!

Not impressed. The app is supposed to enhance the results, and instead it degrades them!  I took a couple of pictures with the ordinary camera app and with this app and compared them. The output from PhotoScan is **very** fuzzy - almost as if seen through beer goggles. This is similar with what happ...Full ReviewNot impressed. The app is supposed to enhance the results, and instead it degrades them!  I took a couple of pictures with the ordinary camera app and with this app and compared them. The output from PhotoScan is **very** fuzzy - almost as if seen through beer goggles. This is similar with what happens with some Panorama stitchers, which I guess it shares algorithms with. However, where as with Panorama stitchers this may be a price worth paying, I'd sooner stick with my scanner, camera and a CamScanner app for my needs.

Interesting concept but not great yet I tested this against just taking regular pictures of photos with my S7 Edge, and Google's photo scanning app doesn't come anywhere close to the quality that I can get by just taking pictures with my smartphone as I normally would. The photoscan app does the work of cropping and in that regard, it's...Full ReviewI tested this against just taking regular pictures of photos with my S7 Edge, and Google's photo scanning app doesn't come anywhere close to the quality that I can get by just taking pictures with my smartphone as I normally would. The photoscan app does the work of cropping and in that regard, it's innovative, but quality is most important to me. Until the photoscan app can produce the same quality I can get with the regular camera app, I won't use it.

Even mini wallet sized pictures looked great.  It took a little practice and the program is pretty forgiving if you accidentally tilt the phone...Full ReviewI really like this app.  I downloaded it weeks ago and planned to capture some memories after Thanksgiving dinner.  I was pretty impressed with the images!  Even mini wallet sized pictures looked great.  It took a little practice and the program is pretty forgiving if you accidentally tilt the phone a little or move it up and down -- best results are with a steady hand and consistent distance though.  Some pictures still had a bit of glare, but I assume it was me being careless because I retook some and there  was no glare the second time.  The edge finder is also a great tool!  I was able to PhotoScan about 70 pictures after dinner and share them with other family who would otherwise have never seen many of them, and now they are preserved forever!!  I still have a lot more scanning to do!! (Pro tip:  Grab a charger!)

That would leave a little more of the process up to...Full ReviewI must agree with many others here: the glare-avoidance feature is awesome, but the output is too low-res.  What  if the app required the user to "zero" each dot - meaning the camera wouldn't capture until the angle and rotation were more accurate? That would leave a little more of the process up to the user (and hardware) as opposed having the software stretch and stitch the snaps together.  I think that would enable print-quality images; as it is now, they only look good on screens.

The BEST APP for a Photo lover. There are very few apps on Play Store which i would be willing to rate. And this is the first time i am writing a review for an app 'cause this app just took my heart away. This is so far the best app developed by Google inc. Scaned some of my old photos so well that one can't tell the difference  b...Full ReviewThere are very few apps on Play Store which i would be willing to rate. And this is the first time i am writing a review for an app 'cause this app just took my heart away. This is so far the best app developed by Google inc. Scaned some of my old photos so well that one can't tell the difference  btw the original & the digital form of it. No GLARES (the best part). Just scan your photo with a white background (so that app can give the best finish at the edges). NO BUGS. It just can't get better.

Google does it again Google's last photo app was Snapseed, and boy was I pleased beyond pleased with that app. Something not necessarily everybody has to install, but it's brilliant anyhow. Same story with this app. They've designed an amazing app that takes photos of your photos. But it doesn't suck! You take five phot...Full ReviewGoogle's last photo app was Snapseed, and boy was I pleased beyond pleased with that app. Something not necessarily everybody has to install, but it's brilliant anyhow. Same story with this app. They've designed an amazing app that takes photos of your photos. But it doesn't suck! You take five photos, one showing the edges, and one at each corner, and it saves it brilliantly. And if it doesn't, you can just go and fix the mistakes yourself. They made that easy too.    Moral of the story, Google's apps rock

What a joke! More like PHOTOSCAM! I get better quality taking a photo with the general on-board camera app and I'm using nexus 6p which has a pretty good camera. Photoscan claims high resolution, no no no, I'd estimate about a third of what my camera can do! Using a real scanner still 10x better! A lot more work to do yet google! Sh...Full ReviewI get better quality taking a photo with the general on-board camera app and I'm using nexus 6p which has a pretty good camera. Photoscan claims high resolution, no no no, I'd estimate about a third of what my camera can do! Using a real scanner still 10x better! A lot more work to do yet google! Shouldn't be releasing products until they are polished.

Solves many photo archiving problems After scanning tens of thousands of photos and slides, Google PhotoScan could have made my life so much easier. Very easy to use, this is a great app out of the gate, and I can't wait for refinements, such as improved auto enhancements and logic for identifying corners and rotation. Can't wait to ad...Full ReviewAfter scanning tens of thousands of photos and slides, Google PhotoScan could have made my life so much easier. Very easy to use, this is a great app out of the gate, and I can't wait for refinements, such as improved auto enhancements and logic for identifying corners and rotation. Can't wait to add that last star!

Date! hi  it would be amazing if you had a feature allowing to manually set the date the picture was taken (the actual metadata of the picture). This way it will be coherent with the Photos app timeline. I don't want my childhood photos to appear in 2016 but in the correct year as I scroll through my phot...Full Reviewhi  it would be amazing if you had a feature allowing to manually set the date the picture was taken (the actual metadata of the picture). This way it will be coherent with the Photos app timeline. I don't want my childhood photos to appear in 2016 but in the correct year as I scroll through my photos.  will that feature be available? I don't want to start scanning without it since it will kinda "spam" my photos timeline.  i will be happy to hear your thoghts and plans on this one . Thanx

Set the Date! It's amazing and I'm really glad Google is supporting this, but here are two requests for future development: 1. Let us set the date! I will never in my life scan a photo that was taken today, so why does it appear in Google Photos as a photo from today? 2. Right off the bat the exposure and white b...Full ReviewIt's amazing and I'm really glad Google is supporting this, but here are two requests for future development: 1. Let us set the date! I will never in my life scan a photo that was taken today, so why does it appear in Google Photos as a photo from today? 2. Right off the bat the exposure and white balance is off. I'll probably want to adjust that on most photos I scan. It would be nice to be able to batch edit the photos I scan in a single session. Regardless of those two issues, thank you Google!

Seemed to work ok. For a small wallet sized photo I needed to get very close or it wouldn't detect the corners. It appears you can't edit the date usi...Full ReviewSeemed to work ok. For a small wallet sized photo I needed to get very close or it wouldn't detect the corners. Also since the goal is to scan old photos it would be good if there were quick way to set the date and add a caption on the photo when it is scanned. This is an awesome start. Been wondering how I was going to scan all my album photos. Tried it on both wallet size and 5x7. App wants to lighten photo which was fine on wallet photo but faded the face on the  larger one. Both were dark photos. Being able to add ability to adjust contrast would make ...Full ReviewThis is an awesome start. Been wondering how I was going to scan all my album photos. Tried it on both wallet size and 5x7. App wants to lighten photo which was fine on wallet photo but faded the face on the  larger one. Both were dark photos. Being able to add ability to adjust contrast would make this really awesome. Don't need date as I can put them in folders by date/description. Thanks. Update- adjusted contrast once saved to photos.

I like the idea, but it just doesn't seem to work on my Samsung S5.  The scanned photos always come out blurry.  Glare is never reduced.  I feel like I could get a better copy by taking a stand-alone photograph than by trying to use this app.  The process is intriguing, and would be great if the pro...Full ReviewI like the idea, but it just doesn't seem to work on my Samsung S5.  The scanned photos always come out blurry.  Glare is never reduced.  I feel like I could get a better copy by taking a stand-alone photograph than by trying to use this app.  The process is intriguing, and would be great if the product was a well scanned photo, but it just doesn't seem to work.  Good luck improving it.

Good start.  - Update Date Taken Metadata- It would be great it you could add dates to the photo metadata or allow a guess. A specific date or partial date can be added per the XMP Spec. - Guessed Date - "Christmas 1990", "Easter 1979". It would be cool if Google could look up public event dates, sa...Full ReviewGood start.  - Update Date Taken Metadata- It would be great it you could add dates to the photo metadata or allow a guess. A specific date or partial date can be added per the XMP Spec. - Guessed Date - "Christmas 1990", "Easter 1979". It would be cool if Google could look up public event dates, say "Woodstock 1969" - Be able to add Location information - Place Name or Lat/Long if available. - Add Photo Captions and save them to the File Metadata. Also, I have a decent camera on my phone and I feel this app does not take advantage of the full megapixel capability of it.

Incredible..... This is an excellent start. I found that glare could remain some times from other sources when using the camera flash for illumination as well. After a little experimentation getting great results every time. With this being the first version, I am very excited to see how the product improves.

Great idea, needs lots of improvement Smart idea, but photos are not 100% "scanned". The app only fix glare and attempt to straighten corners. White balance is off. Capturing the 4 corners is too fast, camera didn't have enough time to focus. Straighten corners is about 90% accurate. Quality of digitalized photo is as good as you're cam...Full ReviewSmart idea, but photos are not 100% "scanned". The app only fix glare and attempt to straighten corners. White balance is off. Capturing the 4 corners is too fast, camera didn't have enough time to focus. Straighten corners is about 90% accurate. Quality of digitalized photo is as good as you're camera phone

Perfect tone, acceptable resolution I was pleasantly surprised by how well this app preserves tone of my black and white prints better than my cheapo scanner. Resolution is good enough for Instagram but that's about it. Great concept and great release, but I would like to resolution bumped up at some point. Also the corner tools are a...Full ReviewI was pleasantly surprised by how well this app preserves tone of my black and white prints better than my cheapo scanner. Resolution is good enough for Instagram but that's about it. Great concept and great release, but I would like to resolution bumped up at some point. Also the corner tools are a bit finicky, but that is more the limitations of touchscreens.

Quicker than scanning but poor quality I have a printer/scanner and there  is no doubt that the speed of this app and it's simplicity are miles better. But (and it's a big but) the quality of the scanned photos is very poor. Camera has no focus facility and it's obviously failing with its auto focus. If quality of your photos is importan...Full ReviewI have a printer/scanner and there  is no doubt that the speed of this app and it's simplicity are miles better. But (and it's a big but) the quality of the scanned photos is very poor. Camera has no focus facility and it's obviously failing with its auto focus. If quality of your photos is important I would wait until this app is improved and stick with manual scanning for your treasured memories

Good idea, clearly a beta release Has definite potential, clever app which matches colour and contrast very well, and stitching is excellent. However, works on a fixed focusing on a Samsung Note 4 aimed about two feet away, so every photo is blurry. Get the autofocus operating and it might be brilliant. Loving this I've been wanting to scan all my photos but have been dreading cause my scanner takes forever. This is so quick and easy. However some of the photos still come out a little glary (especially Top right corner for some reason) or blown out.

This is an excellent start.  I found that glare could remain some times from other sources when using the camera flash for illumination as well.  After a little experimentation getting great results every time. With this being the first version, I am very excited to see how the product improves.

Nice work! Great start, Very simple. Does a nice job of dealing with the glare and distortions you normally get when snapping a photo. Very low quality scans Yes it does remove obvious glares, but the resulting images are very low quality. Take a regular photo of your photos and try to avoid glare by adjusting angles and lights. It'll work MUCH better than what this app can do.

Not working properly Scanning window shows the image with wrong proportions. Flashlight turns off occasionally while scanning. I was able to properly process just one pic from 3 I've been trying to scan. Keep working guys! It's still a cool app no matter what!

Doesn't work. I've seen it demoed two different times. But I cannot get it to work on my Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge. When I take the picture it says move the phone over to the dots but I get a black screen and nothing happens then it tells me I can't complete the scan.

Solid first crack at this app.  Needs two things:  1) The photos need to be higher quality.  The app is currently compressing photos pretty heavily.  It's pretty noticeable when you zoom in. There should be at least an option for less compression.  2) You guys need to go across the hall to the people in charge of Snapseed and steal their white balance tool (including the eyedropper feature of it).  Taking photos of other photos suffers from the same issues with white balance, depending on the lighting the photo is taken in, as regular photos do.  A properly white balanced can easily become unbalanced.  I ran a few through Snapseed's white balance tool and was able to easily fix things, but this should be integrated into this app itself.

Needs tweaking Great idea in concept, but the actual results are poor. "don't worry about glare" it states, but the first attempt I had resulted in the image having a huge glare spot in it. Others have shadows and reflections etc in them and are very dark. Very disappointing.

Once again Google releases an app that's simplistic to a fault. If it works for you it's probably great. If it doesn't work, that's okay, because they give you no manual control to be able to fix it. PhotoScan is an awesome start - but not ready as a replacement for proper scanning of old photos.  It's easy and quick to use, and is forgiving for glare, distance, shakey hands, and alignment.  It's not good on resolution and doesn't allow for fixing meta data (dates, locations, people, events etc)...Full ReviewPhotoScan is an awesome start - but not ready as a replacement for proper scanning of old photos.  It's easy and quick to use, and is forgiving for glare, distance, shakey hands, and alignment.  It's not good on resolution and doesn't allow for fixing meta data (dates, locations, people, events etc) during the process.  But the biggest negative (based on my Samsung S5) is the resolution of the photos if there are anything larger than wallet sized.    So definitely a nice bit of work, but not really a replacement for anything but small headshots or photos.

Needed long time ago This is one of the greatest ideas from Google, but need some improvements  sometimes the photo get cooler or warmer even using the flash.  It would be awesome if they integrate this app w/the camera app and allow to do some adjustments before saving the photo

The previous comments are true, this app is half baked. I'll probably wait for a substantial upgrade. My test picture came out really bad I tried on a picture with a very slight curl to it. The app stretched the faces and everything looked blurry. I was really dissatisfied with all 4 test shots. A normal camera picture with some cropping looks way better. I like the idea though.

Has potential I'm going to be honest, the resolution isn't as great as they boast. But then again, it could just be my camera (Nexus 5x). Incredibly Bad It does a horrible job scanning photos. I don't know if it uses the gyroscope to know where to put the dots, but it doesn't even move sometimes. I'm only giving two stars because of the hilarious ways it butchers my photos.

SuPerB..... Well Done Google All this Time.. I was worried about how to scan all those big boxes filled with old photos.. But thnx to Google... My work is now made very easy... Nd... Time is also being saved... Even my little brother can do scanning of photos with this app... Well Done Google 👍

Good start, interesting approach; but the result quality is mostly useless on todays high resolution devices and monitors. Looking forward for better quality. The results are lower quality than using just the phone camera to take a photo of a photo. There's potential though with development.

Doesn't work Doesn't seem to work nearly as well as promo videos show... Failed edge detection, didn't remove glare from flash, too dark. I expected more from Google then to release something so half baked

Not impressed CamScanner works a lot better. No need to match dots, the picture comes out so much better and works on images and documents, both. I see others have been having some issues with the app but for me it worked almost flawlessly. While minimal cropping was needed on some pictures, as the background they were taken against could be seen on the side of some shots, most of the time the app got it spot on. No flash required and all my shots were taken in indirect natural light which I think made all the difference. I see some people saying the shots are grainy but for my part it did an excellent job and the only grain in the pictures was present in the original in any case. For version 1.0 of an app this is superb in my view and so simple to use.
bad quality The quality is so bad I can't even read the text of a scanned flyer. A single photo is much better. Also the intro is constantly restarting an it took me 2 mins to get in the app

Piece of Garbage DARK pictures. Exposure sucks. Image stitching doesn't come out right. Resolution is not as high as my native camera app captures. COME ON Google. This is why people use apple products; their software just works out of the box.

Works awesomely with the pixel XL For those of you with piles of old prints I just did a test of the new Google Photo Scan app and I have to say it's pretty good. Needs work It gets the circles before focusing on the picture correctly. Results taken with flash definitely don't remove glare. Great idea.. ...but not quite right. Maybe my hand is too shakey but seems to grab the picture before ive had a chance to hover over the 4 circles. Also getting flare from the phone flash.

It's a start I like the the approach it takes to scan in photos and remove glare. Still has some features that could be added and some other refinements. Will offer thoughts like inputting date range or album name into feedback of app. Hopefully Google will keep on adding to it.

Not great. I was excited to scan in some old photos in a box we have. The photos were really low res looking, and quite a few still had glare from the torch light that comes on.  I might try again in a well lit room without the torch and see if that's any better. But so far not impressed.

Promising but needs a lot of work Doesn't focus at all on my note 4. The circles fill up and snap while still moving. Images come out noisy, blurry, and low quality. In a few releases this could be cool. Until then, not so much.

It also allowed me to...Full Review(This was done using a Google/Moto Nexus 6 Shamu)    The very 1st photo I scanned was a Polaroid one, I only had to scan it once (somehow I got it to work correctly).  I noticed that centering the dots was a slight challenge as they moved around a bit but the scan worked well.  It also allowed me to remove the white border that accompanies Polaroid photos.  This was also a challenge because the cropping tool is very sensitive but the end result was a clean, clear photo...even though the color of the original image would need to be enhanced or played around with a bit to get an even more crisp finish, I'm more than pleased with this app.  As they work to improve it this will no doubt be a "go-to" tool for those who'd like to preserve older photos quickly and w/o the need to locate a professional scanning machine or service...     Good Job Google

Another beta released as final product? The interface is simple and easy-to-use, the app is fast, BUT it lacks in picture quality, which (in most photo collectors' opinions) is a deal breaker. Resolution of scans is set at a fixed 2000px on the long end, resulting in pictures that will only look good on your phone. Also, app's camera has ...Full ReviewThe interface is simple and easy-to-use, the app is fast, BUT it lacks in picture quality, which (in most photo collectors' opinions) is a deal breaker. Resolution of scans is set at a fixed 2000px on the long end, resulting in pictures that will only look good on your phone. Also, app's camera has a fixed distance focus, which means the smaller pictures will suffer in quality and the focus will often miss. Google sells this as a definitive photo archiving solution but in reality it is far from it :(
